intro: Rhexia enervia, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluetail, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces clusters of blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. Rhexia enervia is often found in wetlands, swamps, and along the edges of ponds, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
